# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's how you could define such a function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(input_string, text_width = 10)
    words = split(input_string)
    wrapped_text = ""
    line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) <= text_width
            line *= "$word "
        else
            wrapped_text *= "$line\n"
            line = "$word "
        end
    end
    
    # Add the last line to the result
    wrapped_text *= line
    
    return chomp(wrapped_text)  # Remove trailing newline character
end
```

Here's an example of how you can use it:

```julia
input = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit."
output = wrap_string(input, 10)
println(output)
```

This will output:

```
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit
amet,
consectetur
adipiscing
elit.
```
